Benjamin Devenport

Thank you for:

About Me

Highschool
Sports

I grew up playing a lot of soccer. While I wish I stuck with it, I made a transition to Track and Cross Country and really enjoyed the feeling of finishing a three mile race in record times every week. Threre was something soothing about being uncomfortable for 18 minutes that still confuses me today.

My Free Time
Technology and Health.

Outside of work, if I'm not taking care of my dog I'm either playing video games or spending time with my friends. I've flip-flopped between Xbox and PC gaming over the years. I enjoy working out, and starting work at a local Rock Climbing gym has introduced me to Rock Climbing. I enjoy the puzzle and competitive aspects of these things and I feel as if that's why I keep coming back to them.

Philanthropy
Throughout the Years

In recent years, I have really involved myself in Ohio State's annual Buckeyethon. A 24-hour dance marathon that aims to raise money for children affected by cancer at Nationwide Children's Hospital. Prior to this, I always enjoyed local road races where I grew up that had proceeds go towards charity. I have enjoyed being able to give back every once in a while to this world that has given me so much.

Projects

Project Gallery

Current Pursuits

ReactJS

ReactJS caught my attention due to its ability to create native, responsive applications. While afterwards I plan on learning specifically React Native, ReactJS has an interesting component structure that I believe will be useful in creating truly beautiful and powerful web pages and applications.

Android

While I already feel comfortable with my ability to create a full-stack Android Application, I am learning more to become more autonomous in my android programming. As in, having less reliance on developer pages for components I would like to add to my application. I started making android applications freshman year, but not having any collegiate coursework on it until my final two semesters was a real damper. I have not published any of my school work on the app store, so my goal is to have one published by the end of 2019.

REST

Representation State Transfer was a huge part of the web application highlighted in the gallery above. However, with being able to work with three other partners, and the schear size of the RESTful concept, I want to put more work in to understand the entire workflow of REST and its place in Web Design.

Contact Me

Please note that this website is still under development. My goal was to be able to quickly offer another medium for anyone interested
to see more of my work. Contact information can be found more accessible on my LinkedIn page. I aim to add multi-page
functionality as well as a few interactive Javascript or React Applications. Development began 12/15/2018.
